newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Blighted vessel leaves Indonesian port with CPO.
newsitem.headline: Blighted vessel leaves Indonesian port with CPO.

text.p: Delays in the loading of the MV Antea with crude palm oil, which caused a brief squeeze and lifted offer prices in Europe, have been overcome and the vessel left Indonesia on Wednesday, a port official said on Thursday.
The official said the 16,689-tonne Antea left Belawan Port in North Sumatra for Port Klang, Malaysia early on Wednesday. The 172-meter-long vessel arrived at Belawan last Sunday.
"Some problems with the tanks delayed the loading of the crude palm oil," the official told Reuters from Belawan.
"I am not exactly clear what the problems were, but after several delays the vessel was cleared for loading and left for Port Klang on Wednesday morning," he said.
"It was carrying 3,000 tonnes of crude palm oil," he said. "There was no other cargo on board."
London traders had said one charterer rejected the loading because his allocated tanks were contaminated by a previous vegetable oil cargo. The vessel's final destination was Europe.
